channel.title: Comments on: Using Mirroring to Reduce DB Migration Downtime (Part 2)
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.content:encoded:
Ted,

We are not currently using mirroring in our environment. I will only be setting up mirroring for migrating the data from the old server to the new server.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
Hi David,

Are you referencing stopping the exiting mirroring sessions? If so and mirroring is not already used then yes.

Thanks and hope the post helped you in getting ready for your migration.

Ted

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.content:encoded:
Ted,

I am getting ready to implement what you have described here. It seems to me like it would be possible to skip the intermediate mirror step by restoring the database and log backup to the new server, and then configuring mirroring between the old server and the new server.

Is that correct?
